scenario-group.name: Time to Market
scenario-group.description: Research and Development in the Life Sciences industry includes all processes of medicine discovery, scientific development, and preclinical and clinical evaluation. In order to identify product pipeline gaps, identify the products with the best market opportunities, and efficiently run R&D projects, timely information across the global enterprise is key. SAP's solutions enable customers to optimize investments, by assessing budget, costs and risks as well as forecasting and planning resource capacity. Customers can realize increased efficiency and accelerated development times by capturing critical information across development (e.g. analytical testing, product & packaging specifications), optimizing the Scale-up process and reducing the clinical trial supply cycle time and regulatory submission compilation time. Productivity can be enhanced by efficient collaboration within the company and with business partners.

scenario.name: R&D Administration
scenario.description: R&D Administration encompasses enterprise wide project and portfolio management to ensure an optimized use of the R&D investment and resources. It ranges from planning and forecasting, over budgeting and cost controlling to resource and capacity management. It delivers timely and accurate data for decision support, aligns project performance with company goals and increases the efficiency of the development process.

process.name: Portfolio Management
process.description: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and analyze portfolio to determine profitable or non-profitable projects. Ensure that risk is distributed evenly across the portfolio to avoid reliance on high-risk projects. Determine critical success factors and prioritize your projects, as well as outline several what-if scenarios. Enable invest or divest decision support across multiple projects.

process-feature.name: Profitability Analysis
process-feature.description: Monitor KPIs and analyze portfolio to determine cash cows and white elephants in the current project mix.

process-feature.name: Risk Management
process-feature.description: Ensure that risk is distributed evenly across the portfolio, avoid reliance on high-risk projects only.

process-feature.name: Scenario Simulation
process-feature.description: Determine critical success factors and prioritize your projects, as well as outline several what-if scenarios .

process-feature.name: Investment Management
process-feature.description: Enable invest / divest decision support across multiple projects

variant.name: Strategic Portfolio Management
variant.description: The primary challenge of strategic portfolio management is to provide a comprehensive up-to-date view of a company’s entire project portfolio and answer several important questions. Is the portfolio aligned with corporate goals? What is the future demand for resources and what is the capacity? Are the most skilled employees working on the most appropriate projects? Will the portfolio meet its business performance targets? What are the risks and impact of a delay? Timely answers to these questions are critical in determining which projects to pursue and which ones to fix or cancel. Project registration and enforcing an enterprise-wide decision making process for approving projects is an additional critical area in strategic portfolio management. Strategic portfolio management combines and gives visibility into the financial, strategic and operative aspects across your entire project portfolio to enforce governance, to make fact-based decisions and to maximize return on existing assets.

variant.name: Project Accounting with cProjects
variant.description: You can use this business process to plan, budget, and monitor the costs and revenues of a project. cProjects provides capabilities for multilevel controlling using internal orders or WBS elements in mySAP ERP. All costs and revenues for a project are then collected in these cost collectors. Project accounting fulfills different purposes in the different phases of a project:Project Accounting allows you to create cost and revenues estimates based on project information. During project execution all actual costs and revenues from various sources are tracked and continually monitored versus planned figures.

kpi.name: Time to Market
kpi.definition: The time between the start of a project, development or new product to the time it appears in the market
kpi.calculation: Number of weeks between initial idea and delivery of 1st series

kpi.name: Average Development Cost per New Product
kpi.definition: Average development cost divided by the number of new products
kpi.calculation: Average development cost / Number of new products

kpi.name: R&D costs as a % of Revenue
kpi.definition: The R&D costs expressed as a percentage of revenue.
kpi.calculation: R&D Costs / Revenue * 100

kpi.name: ROI
kpi.definition: For a given use of money in an enterprise, the ROI (return on investment) is how much "return," usually profit or cost saving, results. Income = Operating Profit, EBIT, NOPAT, Net Income; Capital = Total Assets, Total Assets less current liabilities, Stockholders' Equity, Operating Assets, Net Assets.
kpi.calculation: Income / Capital * 100

kpi.name: Cash Flow Return On Investment
kpi.definition: Cash Flow Return On Investment compares the cash flow of a firm to its owners with the total assets employed to generate those flows. CFROI is calculated in two steps. First, it measures the inflation-adjusted cash flows available to all capital owners in the firm and compares them with the inflation-adjusted gross investment made by the capital owners. Then the ratio of gross cash flow to gross investment is translated into an internal rate of return by recognizing the finite economic life of depreciating assets and the residual value of nondepreciating assets such as land and working capital.
kpi.calculation: Gross Cash Flow/Gross Investment

scenario.name: Drug Discovery
scenario.description: The research process that identifies molecules or active substances with desired biological effects that address a defined target and have promise as new therapeutic drugs. Thousands of substances will be screened to find the most promising leads that will subsequently be optimized, stabilized and later on tested in animals and humans.

process.name: Target Evaluation
process.description: To treat a particular disease, it is first necessary to identify the biological and/or therapeutic target (i.e., a protein or gene) known to be involved in the study of causes of a specific disease. The process starts with the discovery of targets (agents or class of agents) with particular activity. Target defines the molecules in the body that may be addressed by or interact with drug or drug candidate to produce a therapeutic effect. Pharmaceutical companies start this process by gaining a better definition of disease, a better stratification of patients and improved disease staging.

process.name: Lead Finalization
process.description: Once the therapeutic target has been identified, scientists must then find one or more leads (e.g., chemical compounds or molecules) that interact with the therapeutic target so as to induce the desired therapeutic effect. In order to discover the compounds whose pharmacological properties are likely to have the required therapeutic effects, researchers must test a large variety of them on one or more targets. Lead is a representative of a compound series with sufficient potential (as measured by potency, pharmacokinetics, physicochemical properties, absence of toxicity) to progress to a full drug development program.

process.name: Preclinical Trials
process.description: Beginning with preclinical research, new chemical and/or molecular entities (NCEs / NMEs) are discovered in laboratories and tested in animals. Optimized leads are tested in preclinical conditions for safety, toxicity, etc. to develop different dosages and pharmaceutical formulations. If a compound is thought to be safe and effective as a chemical agent, a pharmaceutical company then submits an application for an investigational new drug to the regulatory authorities in order to be allowed to introduce it to humans during the clinical trial stage. .

business-objective.name: Support corporate memory vs individual memory
Integrate processes across divisions and functions

scenario.name: Bio/Pharmaceutical Development
scenario.description: Pharmaceutical Development of a new drug starts with an active substance or molecule, which has been selected for further development on the basis of its pharmacological properties.It describes the rational process to identify the best vehicle to enhance product stability and product delivery. It defines the form of a medication, determines how it can be administered and protected from external influences that can harm the efficacy of the drug.

process.name: Analytical Development
process.description: The complexity of the structure and function of many medicinal products necessitates a wide range of analytical procedures to adequately characterize the product with information regarding the potency and purity of ingredients. Documentation of ingredients characteristics is done for quick estimation of physical and chemical characteristics comparison and selection of optimal alternatives for stability testing. In order to find the best leads, researchers study a multitude of research libraries and share product and process knowledge.

sap-product.name: Scale Up Management System (SUMS) R1 by Conformia
sap-product.key: Scale Up Management System (SUMS) R1 by Conformia

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in ERP
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate vendors. The Vendor Evaluation component supports you in optimizing your procurement processes for both materials and services. Vendor evaluation is completely integrated into the Materials Management component. This means that information such as delivery dates, prices, and quantities can be taken from purchase orders and goods receipts. Vendor Evaluation also uses data from the Quality Management component, such as the results of incoming inspections or quality audits. The Vendor Evaluation component helps you select sources of supply and facilitates the continual monitoring of existing supply relationships. The standard system offers you a scoring range from 1 to 100 points, which is used to measure the performance of your vendors on the basis of five main criteria:You can also define other or further main criteria, as required. You can assign different weights to the individual criteria.

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in SRM
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate your vendors on the basis of Web-based surveys. In order to meet your specific reporting requirements, you can configure individual surveys and questionnaires, select the criteria that you want to evaluate, and stipulate when the evaluation is to take place. After the data has been transferred to SAP Business Information Warehouse, several analyses are available to help you to select suitable vendors and negotiate best conditions. Vendor evaluation is integrated into the following SAP Enterprise Buyer applications:It is used with the confirmation and invoice applications to evaluate day-to-day activities on the basis of operational documents. It is also applicable in conjunction with the vendor list to improve the strategic and long-term vendor relationships.

process.name: Stability Testing
process.description: Create and process stability study plans. Monitor follow-up actions for completion or deactivation or cancellation according to planned schedule. Confirm stability by analyzing quality inspection characteristics like purity, contamination and shelf life of materials under certain storage conditions. Evaluate stability study results and perform quality control measures which cover the flexible specification inspection about the characteristics of samples as per inspection plan.

process.name: Specification & Formulation
process.description: Medications consist of active ingredients (chemicals) combined with inactive ingredients. Formulation is effective mixing of ingredients to produce new/improved products. Modification of the drug formulation is not only required to optimize delivery with the device or mechanisms like oral (solid or liquid), syringe etc but is also critical to devise marketing plans and price for the product. Adhering to S88 standards for batch management, tableting is a phase in the manufacturing process where various compounds undergo some change in state by means of press and other process parameters until the final product form is achieved.

scenario.name: Clinical Trial Management
scenario.description: Clinical Trial Management focuses on a smooth study cycle, which involves finding enough patients and investigators. It involves study design, initiation, training for investigators, auditing sites and monitoring the study process. Besides the pure Clinical Trial Management, data management also needs to be considered. Patient data is collected electronically or on paper and will undergo vigorous quality checks, before it is statistically analyzed and used as a basis of the regulatory submission.

process.name: Study Definition & Design
process.description: Clinical trial is a research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people and investigate if they are safe and effective. Clinical study design incorporates the methodology and experimental methods (i.e., randomization, treatment protocol, patient population, and sample size). The clinical study protocol is the reference document for the clinical study definition and design. Additional documents required include data collection forms and instructions.

process.name: Patient Recruitment & Enrollment
process.description: Manages the recruitment and enrollment of patient groups for phase I - IV clinical trials (early phase trials through mega-trials involving tens of thousands of patients on a global basis). Enables direct (i.e., clinical contact, screening, and direct mailing) and indirect (i.e., referring physicians, retrospective record view, radio or TV ads, and Internet) patient contact.

process.name: Investigator Relationship Management
process.description: Manages global investigator relations, training, cost and payments and also the relationship with the Institutional Review Board (IRB). Includes investigator selection and monitoring (the ongoing evaluation of a continuing process to determine when and if changes in that process are necessary for reasons of efficiency, data quality, safety, etc.)..Provides assurance that the proposed research meets accepted standards of ethics and medical practice re-write and ethics committee.

process.name: Clinical Trial Management
process.description: Manages planning, scheduling & tracking of clinical activities for phase I-IV trials. This includes managing clinical trial projects, costs and internal and external resources. Since the coordination of clinical trials is often outsourced it requires collaboration between sponsor and clinical research organizations (CROs). Clinical research associates (CRAs) engage with investigators to exchange trial documents, equipment, and supplies. Clinical trial reporting provides insight into site approval status and enrollment progress, as well as transparency of monitoring activities and patient visits, which is critical for payment generation and study cost tracking.

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in SRM
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate your vendors on the basis of Web-based surveys. In order to meet your specific reporting requirements, you can configure individual surveys and questionnaires, select the criteria that you want to evaluate, and stipulate when the evaluation is to take place. After the data has been transferred to SAP Business Information Warehouse, several analyses are available to help you to select suitable vendors and negotiate best conditions. Vendor evaluation is integrated into the following SAP Enterprise Buyer applications:It is used with the confirmation and invoice applications to evaluate day-to-day activities on the basis of operational documents. It is also applicable in conjunction with the vendor list to improve the strategic and long-term vendor relationships.

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in ERP
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate vendors. The Vendor Evaluation component supports you in optimizing your procurement processes for both materials and services. Vendor evaluation is completely integrated into the Materials Management component. This means that information such as delivery dates, prices, and quantities can be taken from purchase orders and goods receipts. Vendor Evaluation also uses data from the Quality Management component, such as the results of incoming inspections or quality audits. The Vendor Evaluation component helps you select sources of supply and facilitates the continual monitoring of existing supply relationships. The standard system offers you a scoring range from 1 to 100 points, which is used to measure the performance of your vendors on the basis of five main criteria:You can also define other or further main criteria, as required. You can assign different weights to the individual criteria.

scenario.name: Clinical Trial Supply Management
scenario.description: Clinical Trial Supply Management is focused on clinical trial material production, labeling, packaging and replenishment to ensure on time and correct delivery to sites. CTSM supports flexible manufacturing strategies and helps study sponsors manage their process in-house or with their business partners (e.g. contract manufacturers or CROs).

process.name: Planning & Forecasting
process.description: Efficient planning of the clinical requirements for the study protocol and accurate forecasting of drugs based on clinical development plan. Improve supply and demand planning to forecast the exact amount of quantities required for the trial as per the clinical trial protocol thereby reducing clinical supply cycle time and inventory cost. Optimize your production process through advanced materials requirements planning to plan materials, which are required in different shop floor areas, storage locations or by subcontractors and perform availability checks. Automatically generate dependent requirements and send them to the identified source of supply including all relevant details thereby increasing productivity and efficiency.

kpi.name: Forecast Accuracy
kpi.definition: Forecast accuracy is calculated at the shippable end-product level for each distribution channel, and for both units and dollars. Forecast Accuracy = Forecast Sum - Sum of Variance / Forecast Sum. Forecast Sum = The sum of the units or dollars forecasted to be shipped in each month based upon the forecast generated three months prior. Sum of Variances = The sum of the absolute values, at the forecasted line item level, of the differences between each month's forecast as defined above and actual demand for the same month.
kpi.calculation: (Forecast Sum - Sum of Variance) / Forecast Sum

kpi.name: Order Fulfillment Lead Times
kpi.definition: The average actual lead times consistently achieved, from Order Receipt to Order Entry Complete, Order Entry Complete to Start-Build, Start Build to Order Ready for Shipment, Order Ready for Shipment to Customer Receipt of Order.
kpi.calculation: (Sum of time difference between 'Order Entry' - 'Customer Receipt of Orders') / Total number of orders

kpi.name: Inventory Carrying Costs
kpi.definition: Inventory Carrying Costs are the sum of opportunity cost, shrinkage, insurance and taxes, total obsolescence for raw material, WIP, and finished goods inventory, channel obsolescence and field sample obsolescence.
kpi.calculation: Opportunity cost + shrinkage + insurance and taxes + total obsolescence for inventory + channel obsolescence + field sample obsolescence

scenario.name: Regulatory Submission
scenario.description: The responsibility to ensure product safety and quality of drugs to their respective market is a key responsibility for regulatory agencies and a great impact on the industry. The need to gain approval or communicate to regulatory agencies throughout the product lifecycle becomes challenging as each country has their own requirements. Beginning with the content and source management, regulatory submissions must comply with the regulations that describe the structure and content of electronic or paper submission dossiers and additional communications.

process.name: Content & Source File Management

Track changes, handle versions and support electronic signature.Ensure that information is retained throughout the enterprise and shared between departments to avoid duplicate work. Manage data i.e. from toxicology studies, patient information and statistical analysis and include it into the regulatory submission dossier.

scenario-group.name: Product Quality
scenario-group.description: As regulatory agencies continue their close global vigilance on the manufacturing practices in the Life Sciences industry to improve drug quality and safety, companies are also under increasing cost pressures that forces them to manufacture their products more efficiently. A key differentiator is the ability to enforce compliance throughout the manufacturing process. Achieving this goal requires the ability to improve product quality by decreasing the manufacturing variability therefore reducing the risk of non-compliance. An increase in production efficiency can be realized by integrating key information across the organization including capturing quality and equipment information into one system of record that can be easily maintained. This single view of the manufacturing data and processes will lead to a consistent and compliant batch record.

scenario.name: Procure to Pay
scenario.description: Procure to Pay is the process of obtaining and managing all raw materials needed for manufacturing. This cycle starts with the source selection, auditing followed by procurement of goods and services. The contracts with the suppliers are managed and can also include supplier managed inventories or direct inventory visibility. It also comprises direct procurement requirements through conversion from demands to purchase orders and confirmation of goods receipt. The incoming materials are then inspected and posted into inventory as part of managing the warehouse. The last activity in this cycle is payment of the suppliers which consists of receiving, entering and checking vendor's invoice for correctness.

process.name: Sourcing & Planning
process.description: Improving the product quality and lower the costs for material acquisition by qualifying a supplier is mandatory for companies in a regulated environment. A supplier qualification that is compliant to regulatory requirements (e.g. 21CFR Part211) includes the inspection of incoming goods, an audit of the vendor and contractual agreements about product quality and financial conditions. These preconditions enable a pharmaceutical manufacturer to plan the procurement of the demands that results out of an MRP run or manually created purchase requisitions.

process-feature.description: Plans the purchasing of certain materials over a time horizon. Material scheduling has an impact on the overall manufacturing schedule.

Vendor Evaluation also uses data from the Quality Management component, such as the results of incoming inspections or quality audits. The Vendor Evaluation component helps you select sources of supply and facilitates the continual monitoring of existing supply relationships. The standard system offers you a scoring range from 1 to 100 points, which is used to measure the performance of your vendors on the basis of five main criteria:You can also define other or further main criteria, as required. You can assign different weights to the individual criteria.

variant.name: Developing Contracts
variant.description: Developing contracts describes the process of

variant.name: Conducting Live Auctions
variant.description: This business process is used to host and manage online reverse auctions in a real-time environment. Purchasing professionals can automatically generate an auction, populate the interface with all information needed to start the bidding process, and notify all qualified suppliers selected to participate in the event. They can also create auctions directly from bid invitations. Purchasers can generate auctions automatically, via the sourcing application, for example. The purchaser must then add any missing information that is required to start the bidding process and notify all qualified suppliers selected to participate in the event. They can also create auctions directly from bid invitations, which also enables them to include existing bids in the auction. The creation process includes several options for populating auctions with data, for example the purchaser can copy an existing auction or use a template to create a new auction. The purchaser can download an auction for offline editing and later upload the changed file. Purchasers can set auction parameters to best meet their business needs. For example, they can, where appropriate, stipulate the level of bid decrement for each new bid submitted; in addition, they can decide whether proxies are permitted, whether items should end on a cascading basis, and whether certain items are grouped together as a lot. Reverse auctions can drive bottom-line results significantly by putting suppliers into direct competition, which ultimately benefits the buyer. Purchasers can reject or accept bids, then create a purchase order or contract using a one-step approval workflow. All bid information resulting from an auction is copied to the SRM backend, allowing for optional follow-on activities.

sap-product.name: mySAP Supplier Relationship Management: Strategic Sourcing

process-step.name: Define discounts based on released values

variant.name: Managing Bidding Events
variant.description: You can use this business process to invite suppliers to submit bids in response to a bid invitation.Since negotiation is a critical step in the sourcing process, purchasing companies can use bid invitations to invite qualified suppliers to offer materials or services according to requirements. Typically, the supplier’s offer is final and binding and there is no opportunity for lowering bids. This makes bid invitations slightly less competitive than reverse auctions.This business process supports and streamlines bid invitation processes, enabling users to create bid invitations out of existing contracts and requisitions. It also provides the tools needed to quickly convert received bids into purchase orders or contracts. This accelerates the bid invitation process and vastly increases the productivity of purchasing professionals.

variant.name: Managing Collaborative Bidding Events using cFolders

process-step.name: Update collaborative documents in PLM using cFolders

variant.name: Monitoring Contracts
variant.description: This process describes how use the monitoring capabilities in order to send and receive alerts about contracts as well as processing the reports.

variant.name: Negotiating Contracts
variant.description: You can use this process either to· Negotiate a new contract using a special transaction type in SAP Bidding Engine· Renew an existing contract that has been released already.In this case it is triggered in the contract application of SAP Enterprise Buyer and moved to SAP Bidding Engine. The supplier then submits new contract details or updates existing ones, such as target value or conditions.

variant.name: Processing Contracts and Sourcing Rules in ERP
variant.description: In the purchasing component, a contract is a type of outline purchase agreement against which release orders (releases) can be issued for agreed materials or services as and when required during a certain overall time-frame.The source list is used in the administration of sources of supply. It specifies the allowed (and disallowed) sources of a material for a certain plant within a predefined period.

variant.name: Processing Contracts and Vendor Lists in SRM
variant.description: You use this process to create, negotiate and renew an existing contract with a supplier. This process is triggered in the contract application of SAP Enterprise Buyer and then moves to SAP Bidding Engine, where the supplier updates the contract details, such as target value or conditions.

variant.name: Processing Global Outline Agreements
variant.description: You can use this business process to create a global outline agreement in SAP Enterprise Buyer and distribute its data to the authorized purchasing organizations in the backend systems of your corporate group. You can then generate either an operational purchase contract or a scheduling plan.

variant.name: Searching for Sources of Supply
variant.description: You can use this business process to process all your requirements and optimize your source of supply for each individual item. You can identify saving opportunities and evaluate suppliers in their ability to provide materials and services at low cost, high quality, and according to schedule.Once you have determined the best source of supply for your requirements, you can collaborate in project teams both internally and with your suppliers, and establish on-going relationships based, for example, on contracts and global outline agreements.

process.name: Supplier Collaboration
process.description: Supplier collaboration provides a cost-effective way for companies to improve replenishment cycles and quality of materials delivered by a trusted supplier. Order collaboration capabilities provide suppliers and buyers with a streamlined order management system, a user friendly interface and comprehensive search options. The collaboration with suppliers can be extended to a vendor managed inventory, where the manufacturer grants authorization to manage his inventory.

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Sourcing for Life Sciences
sap-product.key: SAP Extended Sourcing for Life Sciences

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Procurement for Life Sciences

process-feature.name: Design Collaboration
process-feature.description: Allows collaboration with the suppliers sharing relevant design documents maintaining material quality

process-feature.name: Inventory Collaboration
process-feature.description: Allows manufacturers suppliers and their suppliers to set stock levels and lets the supplier manage certain inventories (SMI)

variant.name: Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlements (ERS) in ERP
variant.description: Procedure for settling goods receipts automatically. When you use Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS), you have an agreement with the vendor that they do not create an invoice for an ordering transaction, but post them yourself based on information contained in purchase orders and goods receipts. ERS has the following advantages: • Purchasing transactions are closed more quickly. • Communication errors are avoided. • There are no price and quantity variances in Invoice Verification.

variant.name: Carrying out Third Party Rebilling
variant.description: You can use this business process to invoice your customers for specific services that were performed by external staff. If you want to use these functions, you need to create a purchase order in SRM which references an existing sales order in the backend system. If external staff have access to a supplier system such as SAP Supplier Self-Services, they can enter their services themselves and send this data to the purchaser as a SAP XML message. Alternatively, they can send service entry sheets to purchasers by e-mail, fax, or regular mail. Purchasing assistants then enter the data on the service entry sheets in SAP Enterprise Buyer. This data forms the basis for the rest of the billing process in the backend system.

process-step.name: Create purchase order based on sales order
Create service entry sheet in EBP
Create service entry sheet in SUS
System creates customer invoice in ERP

variant.name: Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) for Services
Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) for Services
Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) in SRM
variant.description: Procedure for generating and settling invoices automatically. Using Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) means that you have an agreement with your suppliers that they do not create invoices for ordering transactions, but you post them yourself based on the information contained in purchase orders and service entries. Thus, ERS has the following advantages: - Purchasing transactions are closed more quickly. - Communication errors are avoided. - There are no price and quantity variances in Invoice Verification.

process-step.name: Create invoice with evaluated receipt settlement (ERS)

variant.name: Processing Invoice Plan Settlements in ERP
variant.description: The invoicing plan is a facility that allows you to schedule desired invoicing dates for planned procurements independently of the receipt of the relevant goods or performance of the relevant services. It lists the dates on which you wish to create and then pay the invoices in question.

variant.name: Processing Invoices in SRM
variant.description: As vendor or service provider, all invoices that you can enter or process in SAP Enterprise Buyer must be approved by a responsible internal employee. For goods or services with a low purchase value, invoices and credit memos can also be created without a purchase order reference. Moreover, it is also possible to create express invoices in the check status application.

variant.name: Processing Invoices in SRM using IMS

process-step.name: System approves invoice triggered from CRM
System cancels invoice triggered from CRM

variant.name: Verifying Logistics Invoices in Background
variant.description: In Logistics Invoice Verification, incoming invoices are verified in terms of their content, prices and arithmetic. When the invoice is posted, the invoice data is saved in the system. The system updates the data saved in the invoice documents in Materials Management and Financial Accounting. An invoice can be processed in Logistics Invoice Verification in background modus: • Invoice Verification in the background You receive an invoice, only enter the total amount of the invoice and match the invoice up with another system document. The system then checks the invoice in the background. If no errors occur, the system also posts the invoice in the background. If errors do occur, the system saves the invoice and you then have to process it in a separate step. You can post invoices with reference to purchase orders or to goods receipts. You can post invoices without reference to a purchase order, too. • Invoices received via EDI or XML You can process invoices also via EDI or XML, i.e. the invoice information enters the SAP R/3 System via electronic data interchange and the system tries to post the invoice automatically.

variant.name: Verifying Logistics Invoices Online
variant.description: In Logistics Invoice Verification, incoming invoices are verified in terms of their content, prices and arithmetic. When the invoice is posted, the invoice data is saved in the system. The system updates the data saved in the invoice documents in Materials Management and Financial Accounting. An invoice can be processed in Logistics Invoice Verification in online modus: • Invoice verification online You receive an invoice and enter the information contained in it in the system, comparing the data (such as quantities and values) suggested by the system with that in the invoice and making any necessary corrections. You then post the invoice. • Document parking You receive an invoice, enter the data in the system, and save the invoice document. The system does not make any postings. You can change this parked document. When you have finished changing the document, you can post the parked document. You can post invoices with reference to purchase orders or to goods receipts. You can post invoices without reference to a purchase order, too. • Invoices received via EDI or XML You can process invoices also via EDI or XML, i.e. the invoice information enters the SAP R/3 System via electronic data interchange and the system tries to post the invoice automatically.

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in ERP
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate vendors. The Vendor Evaluation component supports you in optimizing your procurement processes for both materials and services. Vendor evaluation is completely integrated into the Materials Management component. This means that information such as delivery dates, prices, and quantities can be taken from purchase orders and goods receipts. Vendor Evaluation also uses data from the Quality Management component, such as the results of incoming inspections or quality audits. The Vendor Evaluation component helps you select sources of supply and facilitates the continual monitoring of existing supply relationships. The standard system offers you a scoring range from 1 to 100 points, which is used to measure the performance of your vendors on the basis of five main criteria:You can also define other or further main criteria, as required. You can assign different weights to the individual criteria.

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in SRM
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate your vendors on the basis of Web-based surveys. In order to meet your specific reporting requirements, you can configure individual surveys and questionnaires, select the criteria that you want to evaluate, and stipulate when the evaluation is to take place. After the data has been transferred to SAP Business Information Warehouse, several analyses are available to help you to select suitable vendors and negotiate best conditions. Vendor evaluation is integrated into the following SAP Enterprise Buyer applications:It is used with the confirmation and invoice applications to evaluate day-to-day activities on the basis of operational documents. It is also applicable in conjunction with the vendor list to improve the strategic and long-term vendor relationships.

process.name: Procurement
process.description: Improving procurement processes and integrate them across divisions will lower the costs of procured good and the work-in-process inventory. The procurement process consists of the administrative functions, such as contract management and the creation of purchase requisitions. Requisitions have to be converted to purchase orders or delivery schedules for a scheduling agreement and the fulfillment of the documents after electronic transfer to business partners has be to monitored.. After successful delivery of the purchased goods, the follow-up operational tasks such as supplier payment, warranty issues have to be performed.

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Sourcing for Life Sciences
sap-product.key: SAP Extended Sourcing for Life Sciences

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Procurement for Life Sciences
sap-product.key: SAP Extended Procurement for Life Sciences

process-feature.name: Contract Management
process-feature.description: The solution for defining the prices and conditions with the suppliers which includes: control rebates, contract conditions and delivery conditions.

process-feature.name: Purchase Requisitions
process-feature.description: This solution creates purchase requisitions as a result from a planning run and converts them into purchase orders

process-feature.name: Purchase Orders
process-feature.description: This solution creates purchase requisitions as a result from a planning run and converts them into purchase orders

process-feature.name: Accounts Payable
process-feature.description: Execute payment of suppliers and handle all financial aspects related to procurement.

process-feature.name: Supplier Payment
process-feature.description: Execute payment of suppliers and handle all financial aspects related to procurement.

variant.name: Processing Purchase Requisitions in ERP
variant.description: A purchase requisition describes a demand that is released to the purchasing department. The demand can be created automatically, e.g. as result of a MRP run or by assigning components or services to a maintenance or production order. Alternatively, the purchase requisition can be entered manually or transferred from another system. The accounting data can already be assigned and checked during processing of the purchase requisition. Sourcing (incl. initiating a RFQ process) can be executed based on a purchase requisition as well as assignment of documents.

process-step.name: Monitor/view list display of purchase requisitions

variant.name: Processing Shopping Carts
variant.description: You can use this business process to fill a shopping cart with goods and services. You can select goods and services, for example temporary labor, from catalogs or enter a description of your requirement or a product ID from the product master. In addition, you can use previous shopping carts and templates provided by the purchasing department for recurring orders. Purchasing assistants can also shop on behalf of their managers. After you have filled the shopping cart with products, account assignment is checked in the backend.

process-step.name: Select items and add to shopping cart

variant.name: Purchase Requisitions with Service Directories
variant.description: You can use this business process to trigger the external procurement of services . You can describe the services requires by an individual long test or by using a service master. As alternative, you can select services from Standard Service Catalogs or from Model Service Specifications.

process-step.name: Monitor/view list display of purchase requisitions

variant.name: Requesting External Staff
variant.description: Before ordering external staff or services, you can send a request to a vendor to get detailed information on a specific service or the availability of individual service agents, for example. As a vendor, you are then notified via SAP Bidding Engine that you have received such a request. When entering a response it is possible e.g. to name the service agent or reject individual items in the request. If pricing has not occurred in the request, you must enter a price in the bid.After the vendor has sent back the bid, you as an employee or purchasing assistant will be notified by e-mail of receipt of the vendor's response.

variant.name: Processing Purchase Orders in ERP
variant.description: The purchase order processing is part of the (operational) procurement of materials and services. The main task is to convert demands (purchase requisitions, shopping carts) to purchase orders (with or without reference to a contract) or delivery schedules for a scheduling agreement and to monitor the fulfillment of these documents.

process-step.name: Monitor/view list display of purchase orders
Monitor/view list display of purchase orders

variant.name: Processing Consignment Orders in ERP
variant.description: In consignment processing, the vendor provides materials and stores them on your premises. The vendor remains the legal owner of the material until you withdraw materials from the consignment stores. Only then does the vendor require payment. The invoice is due at set periods of time, for example, monthly. In addition, you can also arrange with the vendor that you take over ownership of the remaining consignment material after a certain period of time. The consignment stock is managed under the same number as your own stock. Consignment stock can, therefore, be transferred to the available stock. You can define consignment prices in foreign currency. The currency in which the order is placed with the vendor applies for consignment withdrawals. • You can determine period-specific consignment prices. • You can specify the consignment price in any unit of measure. • You can make use of other condition functions used in Purchasing, such as discounts and price quantity scales. • Consignment stocks of the same material from different vendors can be managed independently from one another and at the price of the individual vendors. • Consignment stocks are not valuated. When the material is withdrawn it is valuated at the price of the respective vendor. • A consignment material can be allocated to one of three stock types: o Unrestricted-use stock o Quality inspection stock o Blocked stock You can make transfer postings between these three stock types. Withdrawals can only be posted from unrestricted stock, however.

process-step.name: Create order for replenishment of consignment stock
Receive goods and add to consignment stock

variant.name: Processing Delivery Schedules
variant.description: Scheduling agreements are a form of outline purchase agreement for which the delivery of the total quantity is spread over a certain period in a delivery schedule, consisting of lines indicating the individual quantities with their corresponding planned delivery dates.Scheduling agreement releases are issued to the vendor, instructing the latter to effect deliveries of the relevant material on the dates shown.

process-step.name: Monitor/view list display of scheduling agreements
Monitor/view list display of scheduling agreements

variant.name: Processing Purchase Orders for Subcontracts
variant.description: In subcontracting, the vendor (the subcontractor) receives components from which it produces a product. The product is then ordered by your company through a purchase order. The components required by the vendor to manufacture the ordered product are listed in the purchase order and provided to the subcontractor. The components can be determined by the system via a bill of material. The components can be provided from a third-party-supplier instead of from our own plant. The quantities of the components to be provided to the vendor are entered into the stock of material to be provided to vendor. This stock has the following features: • It is managed as part of your total valuated stock, and is available for MRP. • It is only managed at plant level, since it is not stored at your own company but on the vendor's site. • Two stock types are possible: • unrestricted-use stock • quality inspection stock Stock can be transferred between the two stock types. Withdrawals can only be posted from unrestricted stock, however. • You can take a physical inventory of the stock of material to be provided to vendor

process-step.name: Create/process purchase requisitions for ordered material
Check items for components in purchase orders
Post goods receipt for ordered material

variant.name: Processing Purchase Orders in SRM
variant.description: As soon as a shopping cart has been approved, or a requirement has been transferred from an external system, for example PM, PS or MRP, the system creates one or more follow-on documents. For each product category, you can define where the individual documents are to be created (either locally in the Enterprise Buyer System or in the backend system).

process-step.name: Compare purchase order response with purchase order

process.name: Receiving and Inspection
process.description: Deliveries to the Pharmaceutical companies are subjected to stringent quality procedures to improve the product quality. Warehouse personnel receive the goods, followed by incoming inspection by quality control. The inspection costs can be reduced by use of quality certificates send by qualified suppliers. The stock is moved to quarantine inventory and after the lot disposition they are moved to the appropriate warehouse location. The integration of warehousing and quality control will the operating costs.

variant.name: Confirming Receipts of Inbound goods in SRM
variant.description: You can use this business process to confirm the receipt of goods. In Enterprise Buyer, requesters can create confirmations themselves, even if the purchase order is in the backend system. It is possible to create express confirmations directly in the Check Status application without having to switch to another application. Alternatively, an internal dispatcher or shipping department can take delivery of goods and confirm centrally. In this case, an additional approval workflow through the requisitioner is possible. Then, the goods receipt is posted in the backend system. You can also cancel an existing confirmation at item level. In addition to all of this, you can return partial quantities of individual items (or of all items) to your suppliers, and state the reasons for these return deliveries. These reasons are also transferred to the backend system.

variant.name: Inbound Processing & Receipt Confirmation with Warehouse Management in SCM
variant.description: Companies can receive and process externally procured goods into their warehouse. Using RFID-enabled tools, they can capture detailed and overview information. Inbound processing incorporates all process steps for receiving.

variant.description: Inbound processing covers the physical inbound delivery processing that succeeds the procurement process. It includes ASN processing, physical Goods Receipt up to sending the proof of delivery to the business partners.

variant.name: Verifying Logistics Invoices in Background
variant.description: In Logistics Invoice Verification, incoming invoices are verified in terms of their content, prices and arithmetic. When the invoice is posted, the invoice data is saved in the system. The system updates the data saved in the invoice documents in Materials Management and Financial Accounting. An invoice can be processed in Logistics Invoice Verification in background modus: • Invoice Verification in the background You receive an invoice, only enter the total amount of the invoice and match the invoice up with another system document. The system then checks the invoice in the background. If no errors occur, the system also posts the invoice in the background. If errors do occur, the system saves the invoice and you then have to process it in a separate step. You can post invoices with reference to purchase orders or to goods receipts. You can post invoices without reference to a purchase order, too. • Invoices received via EDI or XML You can process invoices also via EDI or XML, i.e. the invoice information enters the SAP R/3 System via electronic data interchange and the system tries to post the invoice automatically.

variant.name: Carrying out Third Party Rebilling
variant.description: You can use this business process to invoice your customers for specific services that were performed by external staff. If you want to use these functions, you need to create a purchase order in SRM which references an existing sales order in the backend system. If external staff have access to a supplier system such as SAP Supplier Self-Services, they can enter their services themselves and send this data to the purchaser as a SAP XML message. Alternatively, they can send service entry sheets to purchasers by e-mail, fax, or regular mail. Purchasing assistants then enter the data on the service entry sheets in SAP Enterprise Buyer. This data forms the basis for the rest of the billing process in the backend system.

process-step.name: Create purchase order based on sales order
Create service entry sheet in EBP
Create service entry sheet in SUS
System creates customer invoice in ERP

variant.name: Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) for Services
Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) for Services
Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) in SRM
variant.description: Procedure for generating and settling invoices automatically. Using Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS) means that you have an agreement with your suppliers that they do not create invoices for ordering transactions, but you post them yourself based on the information contained in purchase orders and service entries. Thus, ERS has the following advantages: - Purchasing transactions are closed more quickly. - Communication errors are avoided. - There are no price and quantity variances in Invoice Verification.

process-step.name: Create invoice with evaluated receipt settlement (ERS)

variant.name: Processing Evaluated Receipt Settlements (ERS) in ERP
variant.description: Procedure for settling goods receipts automatically. When you use Evaluated Receipt Settlement (ERS), you have an agreement with the vendor that they do not create an invoice for an ordering transaction, but post them yourself based on information contained in purchase orders and goods receipts. ERS has the following advantages: • Purchasing transactions are closed more quickly. • Communication errors are avoided. • There are no price and quantity variances in Invoice Verification.

variant.name: Processing Invoice Plan Settlements in ERP
variant.description: The invoicing plan is a facility that allows you to schedule desired invoicing dates for planned procurements independently of the receipt of the relevant goods or performance of the relevant services. It lists the dates on which you wish to create and then pay the invoices in question.

variant.name: Processing Invoices in SRM
variant.description: As vendor or service provider, all invoices that you can enter or process in SAP Enterprise Buyer must be approved by a responsible internal employee. For goods or services with a low purchase value, invoices and credit memos can also be created without a purchase order reference. Moreover, it is also possible to create express invoices in the check status application.

variant.name: Verifying Logistics Invoices Online
variant.description: In Logistics Invoice Verification, incoming invoices are verified in terms of their content, prices and arithmetic. When the invoice is posted, the invoice data is saved in the system. The system updates the data saved in the invoice documents in Materials Management and Financial Accounting. An invoice can be processed in Logistics Invoice Verification in online modus: • Invoice verification online You receive an invoice and enter the information contained in it in the system, comparing the data (such as quantities and values) suggested by the system with that in the invoice and making any necessary corrections. You then post the invoice. • Document parking You receive an invoice, enter the data in the system, and save the invoice document. The system does not make any postings. You can change this parked document. When you have finished changing the document, you can post the parked document. You can post invoices with reference to purchase orders or to goods receipts. You can post invoices without reference to a purchase order, too. • Invoices received via EDI or XML You can process invoices also via EDI or XML, i.e. the invoice information enters the SAP R/3 System via electronic data interchange and the system tries to post the invoice automatically.

process.name: Inventory Management
process.description: The inventory management comprises control of the stock transfers within the warehouse or intercompany distribution centers, display correct quality status and the accuracy of the physical inventory. Stock status has an impact on production scheduling i.e. a not released material lot must not be used or reserved for production. Automated warehousing and reduction in inventory carrying cost are key strategic goals pursued by the Pharmaceutical companies.

variant.name: Consolidating Master Data in BW
variant.description: mySAP SRM offers a lean yet powerful tool within mySAP BI to consolidate and harmonize master data (vendors, products, product categories) for reporting purposes. This local master data alignment allows you to identify and group duplicate vendors or products coming from the various procurement systems. In the spend analysis reporting, such a group will appear only as one consolidated entry instead of multiple entries (that is, one for each original item). Moreover, it is possible to reassign product categories to a standard category schema. Sophisticated sorting capabilities enable users to process hundreds of master data objects quickly and easily.

process-step.name: Assign purchase categories to standard reporting categories

variant.name: Analyzing Consolidated Procurement Data
variant.description: You can use this business process to perform high-quality spend analyses based on FI documents (primarily invoices and credit memos). By highlighting consolidated spend volume, supplier redundancies, and demand aggregation opportunities, mySAP SRM enables companies to control procurement costs and to enter contract negotiations fully informed. For this purpose, a huge variety of analyses are available, ranging from "Top suppliers", "Number of suppliers per product category" to "Purchasing volume per quarter" and many more. In addition, it is possible to access your company’s most important spend data on one screen using the spend analysis cockpit.

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in ERP
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate vendors. The Vendor Evaluation component supports you in optimizing your procurement processes for both materials and services. Vendor evaluation is completely integrated into the Materials Management component. This means that information such as delivery dates, prices, and quantities can be taken from purchase orders and goods receipts. Vendor Evaluation also uses data from the Quality Management component, such as the results of incoming inspections or quality audits. The Vendor Evaluation component helps you select sources of supply and facilitates the continual monitoring of existing supply relationships. The standard system offers you a scoring range from 1 to 100 points, which is used to measure the performance of your vendors on the basis of five main criteria:You can also define other or further main criteria, as required. You can assign different weights to the individual criteria.

variant.name: Evaluating Vendors and Monitoring in SRM
variant.description: You can use this business process to evaluate your vendors on the basis of Web-based surveys. In order to meet your specific reporting requirements, you can configure individual surveys and questionnaires, select the criteria that you want to evaluate, and stipulate when the evaluation is to take place. After the data has been transferred to SAP Business Information Warehouse, several analyses are available to help you to select suitable vendors and negotiate best conditions. Vendor evaluation is integrated into the following SAP Enterprise Buyer applications:It is used with the confirmation and invoice applications to evaluate day-to-day activities on the basis of operational documents. It is also applicable in conjunction with the vendor list to improve the strategic and long-term vendor relationships.

business-objective.name: Integrate processes across divisions and functions

kpi.name: Source Cycle Time
kpi.definition: Cumulative lead time (total average combined in-plant planning, supplier lead time [internal or external], receipts, handling, etc. from demand identification at the factory until the materials are available in the production facility) required to source 95% (chosen to eliminate outlying data) of the dollar value of materials from internal and external suppliers.
kpi.calculation: Source Cycle Time

kpi.name: Raw Material & WIP Inventory Turnover (Quantity)
kpi.definition: Raw material & work-in-process (WIP) inventory turnover indicates how many times the inventory was consumed and filled up based on quantity. It make sense to measure this for every product. Also known as Inventory Turns.
kpi.calculation: Annual total quantity of transfers, issues of raw material and WIP / Annual average quantity of gross raw material and WIP inventory

kpi.name: Supplier Quality Engineering Costs as a % of Material Acquisition Costs
kpi.definition: The costs associated with the determination, development/certification, and monitoring of suppliers' capabilities to fully satisfy the applicable quality and regulatory requirements. Expressed as a % of Material Acquisition Costs.
kpi.calculation: ( Determination of supplier costs + development, certification costs + monitoring costs ) / Material Acquisition Costs * 100

scenario.name: Compliant Manufacturing
scenario.description: Compliant Manufacturing enables customers to enforce compliance throughout their manufacturing process. This process also supports multiple manufacturing strategies. It begins with order release and material availability check followed by dispensing, manufacturing, and packaging. During the manufacturing process, relevant compliance checks are performed such as operator qualification, equipment checks etc. Shop floor data collection is executed manually by the operator or automatically via standard interfaces. This ensures that all data from lot start to lot finish including deviations from "in process" quality control can be captured in an electronic batch record (EBR) before the product is released for final delivery.

process.name: Process Order Release
process.description: Process manufacturing deals with batch manufacturing adhering to ISA95 standards. On the basis of S88 compliant master recipes all necessary information for production control, like bill of materials, equipments, resources, sequencing of process steps is used to build up the operator log sheet. The process order uses valid master recipe version to communicate to the shop-floor. Consistent master data that are integrated from the planning to the execution reduce the operating costs by better planning on actual data and improved efficiency for multiple locations.

The production process is controlled via an operator log sheet, that sequences the manufacturing steps, automatically checks the qualification of the operator and the status of the equipment to be used. All SOPs used in the manufacturing / packaging process are obliged to an approval process. The integration of in process inspections improves the reliable quality of the product and triggers for the root cause analysis in event of non-conformances. All information recorded in each step of operator log sheet are logged for the central documentation of the lot manufacturing with digital signatures and audit trail adhering to 21 CFR Part 11.

process.name: Release to EBR
process.description: Documenting all data from lot start to production finish including quality data and deviations is mandatory to be compliant with regulations. After production the produced material is approved for further use data by the qualified persons in production and quality personnel. All changes to the electronic batch record have to be documented and should be available on request for a review by the regulatory authorities. The complete view of the electronic batch record improves the production efficiency and reduces paper work.

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Manufacturing for Life Sciences
sap-product.key: SAP Extended Manufacturing for Life Sciences

process-feature.name: LIMS Data
process-feature.description: Allows the transfer of quality inspection characteristics data from quality control to the batch record

process-feature.name: Lot Disposition
process-feature.description: This is the final acceptance/rejection decision on the quality of the material produced by quality assurance.

process-feature.name: Electronic Batch Record (EBR)
process-feature.description: The Electronic Batch Record (EBR) is the equivalent of the â€˜paperâ€™ record. This EBR is a collection of all relevant production, quality , maintenance, qualification data relevant for manufacturing of the batch which is reviewed, approved and stored in appropriate format which can be archived.

variant.name: Quality Assurance and Control
variant.description: Quality assurance and control involves inspections at all stages, continuous monitoring, and quick intervention to deal with unexpected events. Quality inspections can be triggered by various events such as order release or goods movements, but also by manual actions. To document product quality, certificates can be created.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Product Lifecycle Management

variant.name: Quality Improvement
variant.description: Quality improvement means: Notification of quality problems as well as systematic search for solutions and effective processing of actions which are aimed on sustainably controlling and assuring the quality of processes and products. In mySAP ERP the quality notification tool is available for this purpose. The quality notificationcan be equally used for processing improvements of a company's own processes and products, and for processing complaints against suppliers as well as from customers.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Product Lifecycle Management

process-step.name: Carry out corrective and preventive actions
Analyse problem notifications and individual problems

process.name: Reporting
process.description: The reporting provides accurate real time visibility into the order status and actual events on the shop floor. Proactive trending of manufacturing and quality data helps to avoid deviations and helps detection of deviations in a timely manner and prevent reoccurrence. Pharmaceutical companies need lot genealogy reporting to fulfill regulatory requirements.

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Manufacturing for Life Sciences
sap-product.key: SAP Extended Manufacturing for Life Sciences

process-feature.name: Analyze Deviations
process-feature.description: These reports analyze deviations in production to improve quality.

process-feature.name: Trend Analysis
process-feature.description: Using these reporting features trends related to the manufacturing processes and product quality can be determined using statistical control charts.

process-feature.name: Operator Work List
process-feature.description: This report showes the operator work load by production line and provides flexibility to select certain task based on selection parameters.

process-feature.name: Order Status
process-feature.description: These reports are focused on order execution, material consumption, working time and costs.

process-feature.name: Lot Genealogy
process-feature.description: This report covers tracking the usage of material lots/batches in production.

kpi.name: Make cycle time
kpi.definition: The sum of the following average times: Order release to start actual build + Total build cycle + End build to leaves plant (i.e., moves to on/off-site distribution or goes to customer). For continuous and mixed processes, manufacturing cycle time is calculated as the average number of units (cans, kilos, pounds, gallons, etc.) in process divided by the average daily output in units.
kpi.calculation: Make cycle time

kpi.name: Yield
kpi.definition: The ratio of usable output from a process to its input.
kpi.calculation: Usable output / input * 100

kpi.name: Product & Process Data Accuracy
kpi.definition: Indicates the quality of the data that are used for the planning process.(Bills of Material, Routings, Planning Interval data) Only corrections of errors should be counted.
kpi.calculation: Number of corrections made per year

scenario.name: Enterprise LIMS
scenario.description: Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS) are software-based systems that automate the work processes and tedious administrative functions of a laboratory in R&D and manufacturing. LIMS manages the complete test routine including sample log-in, testing, re-testing and final reports. LIMS also includes functions such as stability studies; sample management; inspection plan and test equipment calibration. Enterprise LIMS extends that functionality through the integration to company-wide resource planning systems to include lab management, work scheduling, and product release as well as trending and analytics.

process.name: Laboratory Management
process.description: Laboratory management automate the work processes and tedious administration functions of an analytical laboratory managing complete test routine from sample log-in, tests, re-testing and final reports. The direct integration in the production process enables Pharmaceutical companies to assign the tasks to a certain laboratory and to schedule the workload according to the available capacity. Increasing the service delivery reliability of the laboratory and improving the test cycle time is required.

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Manufacturing for Life Sciences

variant.description: Quality engineering means incorporating quality throughout the entire product development process. This starts with defining deliverables and quality gates within a project, includes inspection planning as well as efficient supplier management and maintenance of quality related documents. In some industries, stability studies are also part of this process.

process.name: Inspection Plan & Sample Management
process.description: The integration of quality management within the supply chain along with standard inspection procedures increases the efficiency and reduces the operational costs by central maintenance. Quality control involves inspections at all stages and quality assurance involves continuous monitoring, and quick intervention to deal with unexpected events. Inspection plans define the planned procedures for a material inspection i.e. incoming, in process, recurring and related parameters like sample size, sampling method etc. Samples are registered in the systems and all tests and actions performed with them can be easily reviewed.

kpi.name: Incoming Inspection Costs as a % of Material Acquisition Costs
kpi.definition: All costs associated with the inspection and testing of received materials to verify compliance with specifications. Expressed as a % of Material Acquisition Costs.
kpi.calculation: ( Inspection + testing costs ) / Material Acquisition Costs * 100

kpi.name: Mean elapsed time to achieve incident resolution or circumvention, broken down by impact code
kpi.definition: Total process time for all incidents divided by number of incidents. Risk management and QM gives input for categorising the impacts; a refelction of every code is recommended.
kpi.calculation: Total process time for all incidents / Number of all incidents

scenario.name: Equipment Maintenance
scenario.description: Equipment Maintenance describes the capabilities necessary for a compliant, fully-integrated, maintenance management system. This includes work scheduling, integrated procurement for maintenance supplies, inventory management and shutdown planning in a web based or mobile solution. Maintenance execution supports problem handling, capacity and requirements planning, spare parts planning, and budgeting. The information from machinery can be collected and automatic status changes can be performed, e.g. upon run time or alerts. The calibration of manufacturing equipment, tools, and gauges further supplements Compliant Manufacturing.

process.name: Equipment Management
process.description: Equipment management is necessary for a compliant, integrated maintenance system, including work scheduling, procurement of maintenance supplies which addresses modeling of equipment and assign all important relevant parameters. The real time information that is updating the status of the equipment makes it possible to assign maintenance plans and schedule according to their status. The maintenance plans are flexible to allow scheduling of activities for preventive maintenance, breakdown maintenance. Optimizing equipment utilization and lowering operational costs is achieved.

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Manufacturing for Life Sciences
sap-product.key: SAP Extended Manufacturing for Life Sciences

process-feature.name: Maintenance Planning
process-feature.description: Maintenance planning deals with the creation of equipment records and planning regular maintenance of the equipment.

process-feature.name: Maintenance Scheduling
process-feature.description: Schedule maintenance orders for equipments and tools/guages, and reserve or order spare parts and service resources as needed.

process-feature.name: Breakdown Maintenance
process-feature.description: Initiate maintenance in event of a machine breakdown including external maintenance execution.

variant.name: Phase-Out Equipment
variant.description: The process of deciding that an equipment has reached the end of ist useful and economic life and is subsequently phased out use.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Supply Chain Management

variant.name: Condition-Based Maintenance
variant.description: Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) enables you to make maintenance decisions based on actual condition, rather than time or usage interval. You can identify equipment problems early, when they are less costly to correct, and perform maintenance only when needed, thereby increasing asset utilization, extending equipment life, and reducing maintenance costs. Examples of CBM are vibration, temperature, oil analysis.Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) enables you to make maintenance decisions based on actual condition, rather than time or usage interval. You can identify equipment problems early, when they are less costly to correct, and perform maintenance only when needed, thereby increasing asset utilization, extending equipment life, and reducing maintenance costs. Examples of CBM are vibration, temperature, oil analysis.

kpi.name: Machine Hour Rate
kpi.definition: The Machine Hour Rate is the cost per hour of running the company's production equipment. The rate includes specific charges to each machine, heating, lighting, building costs, and all other general and service costs. The total of all machine-related and prorated costs are then divided by the number of hours the machinery runs over the period in question.
kpi.calculation: (Machine Related Expenses + Heating, Light, Plant + Overhead)/Annual Machine Hours

scenario-group.name: Time to Value
scenario-group.description: Pharmaceutical companies require the ability to decrease the time from drug launch to peak sales to maximize product revenues, not only by increasing their sales effectiveness but also optimizing their supply chain planning. Successful companies adopt a customer centric approach inorder to integrate new multi-channel marketing capabilities with the classic detailing approach. This allows for better segmentation of physicians through analytical insights and ensure compliance for drug sampling. Flexible and responsive supply chain planning is critical to sustain revenues in an increasingly competitive market. Additional revenue generation can be gained by effectively managing chargeback and rebate volumes through tight control of contract and pricing guidelines helping to reduce overpayment thus improves profitability.

process.description: Forecasting with accurate results helps Pharmaceutical companies having lengthy production cycles to predict the expected production outcome with a high reliability. Balancing the forecast coming from the sales with the predicted demand generated from historical figures is key for achieving optimal results. By applying different forecasting techniques, the variance between the forecast and the actual demand is decreased.
