business-objective.name: Lower cost procured goods and services

kpi.name: Forecast Accuracy
kpi.definition: Forecast accuracy is calculated at the shippable end-product level for each distribution channel, and for both units and dollars. Forecast Accuracy = Forecast Sum - Sum of Variance / Forecast Sum. Forecast Sum = The sum of the units or dollars forecasted to be shipped in each month based upon the forecast generated three months prior. Sum of Variances = The sum of the absolute values, at the forecasted line item level, of the differences between each month's forecast as defined above and actual demand for the same month.
kpi.calculation: (Forecast Sum - Sum of Variance) / Forecast Sum

kpi.name: Inventory Turnover (Quantity)
kpi.definition: Inventory turnover indicates how many times the inventory was consumed and filled up based on quantity. It make sense to measure this for every product. Also known as Inventory Turns.
kpi.calculation: Annual total quantity of transfers, issues / Annual average quantity of gross inventory

kpi.name: Delivery Performance to Customer Request Date
kpi.definition: The percentage of orders that are fulfilled on or before the customer’s requested date.
kpi.calculation: Number of orders that are fulfilled on time / Total number of orders * 100

kpi.name: Number of End Products,SKUs
kpi.definition: Total number of unique end item product offerings. End items are individually planned and managed.
kpi.calculation: Total number of unique end item product offerings

kpi.name: Cash to Cash Cycle Time
kpi.definition: The Cash To Cash Cycle Time represents the time from which your company spends a dollar on purchased material to when it realizes a dollar received in revenue and has a direct impact on your company’s cash flow. Effective Supply Chain Planning reduces the inventory conversion period by manufacturing, processing and selling goods more quickly. This in turn reduces the Cash-to-Cash cycle.
kpi.calculation: Inventory days of supply + Days sales outstanding - Average payment period for materials

scenario.name: Contract Management
scenario.description: The dynamics of today's economy are requiring pharmaceutical companies to rigorously manage costs and government compliance, as they aspire to increase market share with innovative sales strategies. To ensure profitable growth, companies are responding faster and more accurately to changing market demands, requiring well-defined and measurable goals. This is especially true in the area of sales contract development and pricing, chargeback and rebate management. To meet this complex challenge, a total, consistent, and integrated solution is essential. The business scenario Contract Management covers the main business processes of a pharmaceutical or medical supplies manufacturer for contract and chargeback claims management as well as managed care and government rebates. Tight integration into accounts receivable is provided through the dispute management process that allows efficient clarification of disputed invoices and deductions. SAP is working on updates of the pricing bundles to enable best usage of our solutions by the customer and to tailor the bundles to meet customer requirements. They will be available soon.

process.name: Contract Development
process.description: This business process is used to negotiate and capture the contract prices for the eligible end customers. These contracts allow the members to purchase products at a reduced price from the wholesaler even if this price is below the wholesaler’s acquisition cost (WAC). The process covers the contract negotiation process from the receipt of the request for proposal, through the creation, offer, and award of the contract, including the bid award notification to the wholesalers

process.name: Chargeback Claims Administration
process.description: This business process is used to process chargeback claims. Chargeback claims occur when the wholesaler sells the manufacturer material at a contract price lower than the wholesaler acquisition cost (WAC). The chargeback requested by the wholesaler is the difference between the WAC and the contract price paid by the customer at the time of sale. The process allows the correction of incorrect lines, even in an automated or manual fashion as well as performing mass changes on a set of chargeback line items.

process.description: This business process is used to receive, validate, calculate, and settle rebate requests from states for their Medicaid and Medicare programs. This includes calculating prices such as AMP, NFAMP, Best Price, etc. used to support various government programs as well as receiving sales detail data to validate and process these claims.

process.name: Dispute Resolution
process.description: This business process addresses the management of receivables disputes. Each dispute is captured in a dispute case, an electronic record that centrally stores all relevant information. Workflow integration and escalation capabilities streamline the cross-department dispute resolution process within your company. Automatic and manual customer correspondence allows for keeping customers informed and to involve them in the process. With this process you can improve the liquidity and cash forecast and optimize the dispute management.

variant.name: FI-CA: Managing Disputes (Dispute Management)
variant.description: You can use this business process to process dispute cases efficiently in Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable (FI-CA) where these arise when a customer makes a complaint and as a result, either pays only part of an invoice or withholds payment completely.

variant.name: Managing Disputes in Interaction Center
variant.description: This business process enables an Interaction Center agent to enter a dispute case when a customer announces an incorrect invoice, a missing payment, an incorrect or missing credit request. The process also provides a list of existing disputes for the account or business agreement confirmed on the agent, which e.g. can be used to manage disputes on second level processing. During the creation and processing of Disputes, related objects (e.g. disputed objects, further information, correspondence to the customer) can be linked to the dispute, actions and activities (follow-ups) could be triggered and the dispute itself can be forwarded to post processors determined by a partner determination. In this business process it is also possible to grant a credit to a customer e.g. as a part of the managing disputes process but also without referring to a dispute. The credit may be subject to approval before it can be processed through billing and transferred into a posting document. Additionally in exceptional cases it may be required to capture data that will lead to a debit and not to a credit. Then the possibility for the creation of an adjustment request will be provided in this business process.

process-step.name: Identify account for Financial Customer Care

kpi.name: Contract Negotiation Time
kpi.definition: Days (as persondays) required to negotiate contract with clients within a period.
kpi.calculation: Total number of days/Number of contracts

kpi.name: Contract, Program & Channel Mngt. Costs as a % of Order Mngt. Costs
kpi.definition: Includes all costs for activities related to contract negotiation, monitoring progress and reporting against the customer's contract, including administration of performance or warranty related issues. Expressed as a % of Order Management Costs.
kpi.calculation: ( Activities related to contract negotiation costs + monitoring progress costs + reporting against the customer's contract costs ) / Order Management Costs * 100

kpi.name: Potential Exploitation
kpi.definition: How the potential business is realized. The calculation is in case of monetary potential (expected/estimated revenue). If only the numeric potential is available, the 'Covered potential units' are used instead of Revenue.
kpi.calculation: Revenue / Potential *100

scenario.name: Order to Cash
scenario.description: As Pharmaceutical companies are faced with increasing cost pressures due to intensifying competition, one area of focus is increasing order fulfillment efficiency including improved cycle times and accuracy of shipments. This scenario covers the complete Order to Cash process providing faster processing of sales documents, more efficient deliveries, reduction in transportation costs including adhering to compliances requirements, and finally closing out the process with billing. Overall SAP's integrated solution gives users more transparency over the entire order to cash cycle. SAP is working on updates of the pricing bundles to enable best usage of our solutions by the customer and to tailor the bundles to meet customer requirements. They will be available soon.

variant.description: You use this business process in order to create and process a sales order and trigger subsequent logistics processing in SAP R/3. A sales order is a customer’s binding request to an enterprise to deliver a specific quantity of products, or to provide a service at a specific time. A sales organization accepts the sales order, and thus becomes responsible for fulfilling the contract.

process-step.name: Check availability, schedule order, and create customer requirements
System checks availability, schedules order, and creates requirements

variant.name: Assemble-to-Order Processing in ERP
variant.description: This business process enables you to create, issue, and monitor sales orders for customized products or services that are assembled on receipt of order. In an assemble-to-order environment, key components are planned or stocked in anticipation of the sales order. Assemble-to-order production is useful if a large number of finished products can be assembled from common components.

process-step.name: Check availability, schedule order, and create requirement

variant.name: Make-to-Order Processing in ERP
variant.description: This business process makes it possible for you to deliver a specific product configuration and quantity, or to provide a service at a specific time. During sales order processing, a sales organization accepts the sales order and is responsible for fulfilling the contract.

process-step.name: Check availability, schedule order, and create requirement

variant.name: Sales Order and Contract Processing with CRM Mobile Sales Online
variant.description: Displays sales orders and contracts.

variant.description: Processes sales orders within Service Parts Management, which allows to trigger shipping and delivery of the sales order.

System triggers unchecked delivery and customer requirements

variant.name: Sales Order Processing for Service Parts (Third Party Order Processing)
variant.description: Allows to process sales orders within Service Parts Management and to trigger the creation of orders directly. The customer is not delivered by yourself, but the delivery of goods is transfered to an external vendor. The external vendor accepts the purchase order that results from the sales order, and thereby takes on responsibility for fulfilling the sales order.

A sales order is a customer’s binding request to an enterprise to deliver a specific quantity of products, or to provide a service at a specific time. A sales organization accepts the sales order, and thus becomes responsible for fulfilling the contract.

variant.name: Sales Order Processing with CRM Mobile Sales for Handheld
variant.description: This process enables a sales representative to create a sales order using a handheld device and report this data back to the CRM Enterprise. This ensures that up-to-date and accurate information is available both to the sales organization and the sales representatives. In addition, it streamlines operations by immediately processing sales orders.

variant.name: Inbound Telesales with CRM Sales Order
variant.description: Enables a company to offer, sell and deliver products and services through the Interaction Center. Customers can contact your company through their preferred channels, including telephone, email, fax, letter and web chat. Interaction Center agents can provide all manner of information about products and services to the customer via product catalogs, product configuration, real-time available-to-promise for products and access to your company's knowledge databases. Agents can better meet customers' needs with a complete view of the customer, including their purchase history, existing in-process orders, credit rating, customer status & classification, and buying trends. Orders that are placed through the Interaction Center are automatically processed through to production, distribution and accounts receivable.

process-step.name: Process sales order in Interaction Center

process.name: Logistics Execution
process.description: As the supply network of Pharmacaeutical Manufacturers extends to include contract manufacturers and third party distributors, it is critical that Manufacturers can co-ordinate fulfillment processes across multiple parties and have real time visibility to react quickly to any problems and provide customers with continuous and up to date information, while still minimizing internal and external distribution and warehouse costs. Fulfillment co-ordination and visibility controls the actual fulfillment of sales orders, through the management and execution of all related logistics tasks. Sales requirements are increasingly distributed to alternative locations and manufacturers. So the delivery might be shipped to the customer directly from the different fulfilling locations (more than one delivery), or by consolidation to one location and one complete shipment to the end customer.

sap-product.name: SAP Extended Warehousing & Logistics for Life Sciences

variant.name: Customer Profitability Analysis

Customer profitability is most easily calculated as the difference between revenue and costs. It is more useful, however, to perform detailed customer contribution margin analysis including different revenue types, product costs, marketing costs, and sales costs, to produce a differentiated picture of customer profitability.

System updates data in customer knowledge base

System performs derivation and valuation in Profitability Analysis

kpi.name: Delivery Performance to Scheduled Commit Date
kpi.definition: The percentage of orders that are fulfilled on or before the original scheduled or committed date.
kpi.calculation: The number of orders that are fulfilled on or before the original scheduled or committed date / Total number of orders * 100

kpi.name: Number of Orders without Complete and Accurate Documentation
kpi.definition: Number of orders without correct documentation supporting the order, including packing slips, bills of lading, invoices, etc.
kpi.calculation: Number of orders without correct documentation

kpi.name: Order Fill
kpi.definition: Average number of orders that were successfully filled complete for a specific time period divided by the total number of orders placed for the same time period
kpi.calculation: Total Number of Orders Filled Complete / Total Number of Orders Placed * 100

kpi.name: Order Fulfillment Costs
kpi.definition: Includes costs for processing the order, allocating inventory, ordering from the internal or external supplier, scheduling the shipment, reporting order status and initiating shipment.
kpi.calculation: Order processing costs + costs for allocating inventory + costs for ordering from the internal or external supplier + costs for scheduling the shipment + reporting order status costs + initiating shipment costs

scenario.name: Marketing
scenario.description: With the ultimate goal of increasing brand awareness and driving company growth, the marketing scenario covers all processes related to promoting product sales. This scenario encompasses product management, campaign and customer event management as well as key account management. Based on all enterprise wide information sources (sales and delivery data, cost and price information) as well as external data a segmentation of the customer groups is done which is crucial to leverage the cost-intensive sales force and to overcome the current trend of declining sales force efficiency. By assigning the appropriate target group to the different channels (sales force, interaction center, and Internet) as a result of segmentation, all marketing and sales resources are managed to derive maximum sales impact. The consistent planning and execution of campaigns, promotions and events to all types of customers is the other centerpiece of marketing. Key Account Management finally covers all activities towards actual buyers (wholesalers etc.), payers (Formulary Management) and key opinion leaders. SAP is working on updates of the pricing bundles to enable best usage of our solutions by the customer and to tailor the bundles to meet customer requirements. They will be available soon.

process.name: Customer Segmentation
process.description: Segmenting customers and markets is done by using key information such as classification, call frequency, external sales information and prescribing behavior to divide and create target groups. By dividing the market into different segments, there is more effective sales communication and marketing activities such as improved physician detailing and campaign response rates.

sap-product.name: SAP Marketing for Life Sciences
sap-product.key: SAP Marketing for Life Sciences

variant.name: Segmentation
variant.description: Segmentation preparation is a process that is generally performed by the database manager. This forms the foundation for business partner segmentation in the Segment Builder (that is all required attributes are created with the corresponding attribute values and data sources).

process-step.name: Create marketing attributes and attribute set
Define and prepare data sources and create attribute list
Combine attribute values to create marketing profiles
Optimize marketing profiles and profile set

process.name: Marketing Planning
process.description: Within the process of marketing planning, the user defines and structures a plan for all marketing activities such as budget and anticipated sales and then executes the planned marketing processes across various channels. Ongoing performance monitoring ensures that the company cam react accordingly. In addition, historical analysis of the results can be used as a consideration for future marketing planning.

sap-product.name: SAP Marketing for Life Sciences

process.name: Campaign Management
process.description: Campaign management starts with market and customer analysis, continues with execution of the campaign, and ends with the closure of the campaign and analysis of the results. Campaigns serve as operative marketing planning. They describe actions that are carried out, for example, mailings, and detailing. Once a campaign has been set up, it can be tracked throughout its duration and the results used in future planning.

sap-product.name: SAP Marketing for Life Sciences

By maintaining these activities in the system, you are able to monitor your progress in executing the campaign.

process.description: With reps getting progressively less detail time with doctors, customer relationship building through other channels is critical. Conducting customer events is one way to accomplish this while providing the opportunity for continued branding and knowledge transfer to target physicians. This process involves event planning and preparation, event invitation, event execution including attendance tracking/monitoring, as well as post event analysis.

It involves marketing and commercialization plans to deliver sales and profit in accordance with the division's business plan and includes marketing strategy, promotional materials and programs.

variant.name: Sales Planning and Forecasting
variant.description: In Sales Target Planning, a sales manager set sales or contribution targets for the sales employees in the field. Since the sales manager and the sales employees use a common planning platform, the planning tasks performed by the sales manager are closely reconciled with the business planning and operational planning tasks performed by the sales employees. You can specify as many dimensions for entering planning figures (such as sales region, product group) as you need for your planning requirements. The different planners can access the same data but plan at different levels.

process-step.name: Analyze sales with plan/actual comparisons and rolling forecasts
Create a new sales plan for next sales period
Create sub-plans for different territory levels
Plans target quantities, revenues, discounts and costs
Sales team reviews and and returns adjustments to manager
Sales team works on opportunities and sales deals

kpi.name: Campaign/Event Cost Revenue Ratio
kpi.definition: Revenues generated by events and campaigns divided by campaign event costs
kpi.calculation: Revenues generated by events and campaigns / Campaign event costs * 100

kpi.name: Market Share
kpi.definition: A company revenue divided by all the revenue of competitors within the same market.
kpi.calculation: Companies Revenue / Total Category Revenue * 100

kpi.name: Potential Exploitation
kpi.definition: How the potential business is realized. The calculation is in case of monetary potential (expected/estimated revenue). If only the numeric potential is available, the 'Covered potential units' are used instead of Revenue.
kpi.calculation: Revenue / Potential *100

kpi.name: Percentage of Customers getting served via Internet Protocol
kpi.definition: The percentage of customers that get served via internet Protocol (email,...) in comparison to all the customers services (requests) done by a company.
kpi.calculation: Customers that get served via Internet Protocol / Total customers get served * 100

scenario.name: Sales Operations and Performance Analytics
scenario.description: Sales Operations and Performance Analytics covers all back-office activities that support and manage the Field Sales Force. Full Sample Accountability is achieved by close integration with the Field Sales Scenario utilizing the integrated analytical, workflow and case management capabilities. The scenario also covers all analytical back office functions from high level planning down to prescriber level and longitudinal reporting, integrating multiple internal and external data sources, in order to gain full market insight into the prescriber and patient eco-system. Analytical capabilities also provide insight into sales performance, which allows to implement and monitor a given sales strategy through incentives management and territory alignment. SAP is working on updates of the pricing bundles to enable best usage of our solutions by the customer and to tailor the bundles to meet customer requirements. They will be available soon.

variant.name: Incentive Plan Maintenance in ERP
variant.description: You use this process to design your commission plans with all the related master data in ICM. This is the second part of your implementation project. However, you must also carry out any amendments or additions after the implementation, for example if you change your incentive strategy and plans or if you add new commission recipients. To do this, you first define all the recipients of direct and indirect commission, who may be internal employees as well as external partners, as business partners in the role of CACSA1. You then assign the business partners in your sender system to those in ICM. You also define all the different kinds of agreements that exist between your company and your commission recipients. These are subsequently converted into commission contracts. You may use standard commission contracts as templates and individualize them accordingly. You finally assign the commission recipients and their contracts to your company’s organizational structure to allow the recipients to participate in the commission.

sap-product.name: SAP Incentive & Commission Management (applies to mySAP ERP/mySAP CRM)

variant.name: Incentive Processing in ERP
variant.description: You use this process to manage your transactional data and carry out your commission calculations. The process steps are executed automatically by the ICM system. The sender system transfers the commission cases to ICM. Commission cases are the activities of a commission recipient for which commissions are to be calculated. ICM then automatically determines all the other commission recipients who participated in this commission case. ICM also determines the current valuation of the business object, calculates the remuneration amounts for the commission recipients based on their contracts, and posts the results to their ICM accounts. Only if a commission case is interrupted by certain system-defined or customer-defined checking routines and is set to the status “pending”, for example due to missing data or because the defined threshold values have been exceed, it has to be adjusted manually by the commission clerk or the respective manager before processing can be continued. At the end of the period, closing is carried out. All the commission case results are summarized and bonuses are calculated. Any flat rates are added, liabilities or cancellation reserves are deducted, guarantee payments checked and taken into consideration where appropriate. The results are then transferred to the settlement application for payment. After closing and settlement, a correspondence document containing the relevant commission data for the recipients is automatically created. Depending on the reporting system used, the commission results may also be updated there.

sap-product.name: SAP Incentive & Commission Management (applies to mySAP ERP/mySAP CRM)

kpi.name: Customer Satisfaction Index
kpi.definition: Customer Satisfaction Index is an abstract measure how well the company serves the customers. It can't be predefined, because the company has to find out, what the customers want and then look how well they fulfill the needs of the customers. Usually it is an index.
kpi.calculation:
Example for a procedure to calculate the customer satisfaction index:
Within a customer survey customer can assess his general satisfaction to a scale between 1 (totally unsatisfied) until 10 (totally satisfied)
Calculation as follows:
Sum of all rating values / number of participants of survey, then mapping this average value to scale (the higher the value, the better the satisfaction)
This procedure can be executed also for other aspects then "general satisfaction" to develop a deeper insight in the customer satisfaction.

kpi.name: Salesperson's Time Spent Selling (Percentage)
kpi.definition: The time a salesperson spent selling expressed as a percentage of his total time. The measure should show if a sales person can do his/her job or if he/she spends too much time with administration or other things.
kpi.calculation: Salesperson's time spent selling / Total Time * 100

kpi.name: Avg. Sales Rep Expenses
kpi.definition: The average expenses incurred by sales reps in a period
kpi.calculation: Total Expenses / Number of Sales Reps

kpi.name: Customer Call Rate
kpi.definition: Number of contacts/calls per day
kpi.calculation: number of calls per month / number of work days in that month

scenario-group.name: Product Safety
scenario-group.description: Regulatory agencies in the Life Sciences industry are vigilant in assuring the safety of medical products at all stages in the product lifecycle - manufacturing, distribution and consumption or usage. Those companies that excel at proactively managing product safety continuously improve their product quality. The solutions help customers maintain one global system with consistent information regarding all complaints; gain visibility on the progress of investigations and increase speed of communication and issue resolution. Reporting and trend analysis on a global level allows companies to anticipate potential product safety issues by utilizing early warning signals to support corrective actions. The goal of drug tracking and tracing is to prevent unsafe product from entering the supply chain by establishing a secure electronic pedigree so that every unit of medication is authenticated.

scenario.name: Medical Inquiries
scenario.description: Medical inquiries describe the process of recording, processing and managing medical communications through various channels (e.g. call center, Web based interface). A centralized system for capturing the inquiry, searching, and providing solutions to case management and tracking, provides a company with superior customer service and continuous improvement. Inquiries are resolved and closed out or become product complaints or adverse events and routed to the appropriate department for further processing. In addition, secure access controls visibility for tracking critical case information and performing trend analysis across the organization. SAP is working on updates of the pricing bundles to enable best usage of our solutions by the customer and to tailor the bundles to meet customer requirements. They will be available soon.

process.name: Inquiry Capture and Processing
process.description: Improve customer service and quality by enabling call center agents to handle customer interaction across multiple channels (e.g. Web, fax, telephone) and with multiple language support to record medical inquiry information. Streamline response time by classifying the recorded medical inquiries to trigger automatic or manual routing for appropriate response or triage

variant.name: Case Processing in CRM
variant.description: During case processing, the case processor as well as other responsible case employees review the details of the case, including linked objects, case notes, and the case history. Processors can enter additional information to the case as appropriate and also specify further activities that need to be completed and forward these to the processors responsible. They can also link related cases by building a hierarchical structure of cases.User or role-based authorizations determine the cases or case data visible to a processor and the changes that he can make to a particular case.

process-step.name: Assign case owner and case processor to case
Assign electronic forms or documents to case
Assign service confirmation for resources used in case processing
Create new service order from within case
Assign reference categories or classification attributes to case

process.name: Case Resolution & Closure
process.description: Improve speed of case resolution and decision making ability by suggesting remedial action and alternatives. Provide adequate justification and documentation based on supportive data gathered from responsible departments relevant to address the information requested in inquiry. Then merge case related data for generation of a letter/document. Enable verification of the summary data with appropriate formatting and enforce approvals before sending out the documents through various channels of communication to involved parties like patients, physicians, sales representatives. Finally, inform involved parties and maintain the closed case record for specific duration of time.

process.name: Reporting & Trend Analytics
process.description: Focus on two areas: operational reporting and longer-term trend analysis. Operational reporting focuses on day-to-day work related reports for smooth functioning of the call center operations like number of inquiries based on status, priority, region, attributes for a specific period. This tracks case information for management audit and updates thereby providing global, enterprise-wide visibility across sites. Monitoring of trends compares historical with current data to identify existing inquiries or anticipate future inquiry occurrence or accumulation in certain areas. It provides alerts for faster decision making and proactively supports appropriate operations or quality group with additional relevant information in order to improve next generation products.

process-feature.name: Reporting
process-feature.description: Â

variant.name: Case Management Analysis
variant.description: Allows agents to open, edit, and close cases. Enables Follow-up and To Do Items, Case History, and sub case hierarchies. Creates cases with reference to a particular customer or product and can reference business and office documents. Links involved parties and relevant data to the case. Links relevant documents to the case. Monitors follow-up processing steps for one or multiple processors. Handles multiple note types including user/time stamp. Logs and visualizes all changes to a case. Monitors hierarchical links between cases.

process-step.name: Monitor cost and revenue of cases

business-objective.name: Comply with future accounting and regulatory reporting requirements
Lower risk of harm to employees and customers/clients/citizens
Improved transparency and auditability of activities

kpi.name: Customer Satisfaction Index
kpi.definition: Customer Satisfaction Index is an abstract measure how well the company serves the customers. It can't be predefined, because the company has to find out, what the customers want and then look how well they fulfill the needs of the customers. Usually it is an index.
kpi.calculation:
Example for a procedure to calculate the customer satisfaction index:
Within a customer survey customer can assess his general satisfaction to a scale between 1 (totally unsatisfied) until 10 (totally satisfied)
Calculation as follows:
Sum of all rating values / number of participants of survey, then mapping this average value to scale (the higher the value, the better the satisfaction)
This procedure can be executed also for other aspects then "general satisfaction" to develop a deeper insight in the customer satisfaction.

kpi.name: Effectiveness and efficiency of channel selection
kpi.definition: Different communication channels should meet the different expectations and content needs of the stakeholders. From the companies perspectives the channel costs are extremly different and of different use for an active customer developement and relationship management. The questions that have to be answered are: Do we have the right number of different channels? Do the stakeholders use the appropriate one? Do we get transparent information about our products, services the markets etc.
kpi.calculation:
Effectiveness (Doing the right thing): Enterprise objectives (transparent information) of certain communication channel / Input Quantity for certain communication level
Efficiency (Doing the thing right): Value of outputs of certain communication channel / Cost of inputs for certain communication level

kpi.name: Percentage of Service Requests
kpi.definition: The number of service requests from customers expressed as a percentage of total customers in a period. The average number of customer is the number at the end of the period plus the number at the beginning divided by two.
kpi.calculation: Number of Service Requests / Average number of customers * 100

process.name: Case Investigation
process.description: Request physical sample whose details were recorded during complaint capture. Route sample to the appropriate investigation or assessment group which determines the further course of action like testing product specimen in laboratory or checking process consistency in manufacturing or distribution. Case investigation also addresses compensation or delivery of an alternate product to the patient or consumer where required. Case investigation involves analysis of impact on process integrity or product safety and quality, including gathering of information from relevant departments to suggest alternative remedial actions in order to resolve the specific complaint at a faster rate and provide adequate documentation based on supportive data.

variant.name: Inspection
variant.description: Inspections are carried out to check the condition and status of plant and equipment. Typically a group of machines are inspected together in the form of an inspection round. An inspection could result in a corrective maintenance action.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Supply Chain Management

process-step.name: Determine optimum route for inspection round
Put order in process and print or download to mobile device
Perform evaluations in plant maintenance information system (PMIS)

variant.name: Quality Improvement
variant.description: Quality improvement means: Notification of quality problems as well as systematic search for solutions and effective processing of actions which are aimed on sustainably controlling and assuring the quality of processes and products. In mySAP ERP the quality notification tool is available for this purpose. The quality notificationcan be equally used for processing improvements of a company's own processes and products, and for processing complaints against suppliers as well as from customers.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Product Lifecycle Management

process-step.name: Carry out corrective and preventive actions

process.name: Case Resolution & Closure
process.description: Improve speed of case resolution and decision making ability by presenting alternatives suggested during investigation adhering to 21CFR Part 11 requirements. Merge case related data for generation of a letter or document. Enable verification of the summary data with appropriate formatting and enforce approvals before sending out the documents through various channels of communication to involved parties like patients, physicians, sales representatives. Finally, inform involved parties and maintain the closed case record for specific duration of time.

process.name: Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)
process.description: Corrective and preventive action is a formal process required by regulatory authorities for categorizing the issue, documenting, tracking and implementing the findings to prevent reoccurrence of the root cause of the complaint and improving product and process quality. Root cause analysis deals with analyzing in details the source of problem by testing product and process to refine, improve and identify reasons for failure of product or inconsistency in process operations. Electronic CAPA processing also requires satisfying regulatory requirements like 21 CFR Part 11, for example through use of digital signatures.

variant.name: Breakdown Maintenance
variant.description: This form of maintenance is simply “run to failure,” it allows no intervention in plant operation, plant is maintained only when forced by breakdown

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Supply Chain Management

process-step.name: Put order in process and print or download to mobile device

variant.name: Emergency Maintenance
variant.description: This the after the event recording in the system of performing a maintenance action. Typically this includes creating a notification/order, confirming spare parts used, time to perform the task, recrding of damage and cause codes.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Supply Chain Management

variant.name: Condition-Based Maintenance
variant.description: Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) enables you to make maintenance decisions based on actual condition, rather than time or usage interval. You can identify equipment problems early, when they are less costly to correct, and perform maintenance only when needed, thereby increasing asset utilization, extending equipment life, and reducing maintenance costs. Examples of CBM are vibration, temperature, oil analysis.Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) enables you to make maintenance decisions based on actual condition, rather than time or usage interval. You can identify equipment problems early, when they are less costly to correct, and perform maintenance only when needed, thereby increasing asset utilization, extending equipment life, and reducing maintenance costs. Examples of CBM are vibration, temperature, oil analysis.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Supply Chain Management

variant.name: Counter-Based Preventive Maintenance
variant.description: Preventive maintenance work may be due to legal regulations, environmental protection requirements, manufacturer recommendations, or it is executed for reasons of quality assurance. Counter based preventive maintenance means the maintenance cycle is based on a counter e.g. kilometres, operating hours, tonnes throughput etc.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Supply Chain Management

process-step.name: Put order in process and print or download to mobile device
Perform evaluations in plant maintenance information system (PMIS)

variant.name: Time-Based Preventive Maintenance
variant.description: Preventive maintenance work may be due to legal regulations, environmental protection requirements, manufacturer recommendations, or it is executed for reasons of quality assurance. Time based preventive maintenance means the maintenance cycle is based on a time e.g. days, months, years etc.

sap-product.name: SAP R/3 Enterprise / mySAP ERP / mySAP Supply Chain Management

process-step.name: Put order in process and print or download to mobile device
Perform evaluations in plant maintenance information system (PMIS)

process.name: Reporting & Trending Analytics
process.description: Focus on two areas: operational reporting and longer-term trend analysis. Operational reporting focuses on day-to-day work related reports for smooth functioning of the complaint management operations like number of complaints based on status, priority, region and attributes for a specific period. This tracks case information for management audit and updates thereby providing global enterprise wide visibility across sites. Monitoring of trends compares historical with current data to identify existing complaints or anticipate future complaints occurrence or accumulation in certain areas. It provides alerts for better decision making and proactively supports appropriate operations or quality group with additional relevant information in order to improve next generation products.

business-objective.name: Comply with future accounting and regulatory reporting requirements
Lower risk of harm to employees and customers/clients/citizens
Improved transparency and auditability of activities

kpi.name: Customer Satisfaction Index
kpi.definition: Customer Satisfaction Index is an abstract measure how well the company serves the customers. It can't be predefined, because the company has to find out, what the customers want and then look how well they fulfill the needs of the customers. Usually it is an index.
kpi.calculation:
Example for a procedure to calculate the customer satisfaction index:
Within a customer survey customer can assess his general satisfaction to a scale between 1 (totally unsatisfied) until 10 (totally satisfied)
Calculation as follows:
Sum of all rating values / number of participants of survey, then mapping this average value to scale (the higher the value, the better the satisfaction)
This procedure can be executed also for other aspects then "general satisfaction" to develop a deeper insight in the customer satisfaction.

kpi.name: Percentage of Customer Complaints
kpi.definition: Number of customer complaints expressed as a percentage of total customers in a period. The average number of customer is the number at the end of the period plus the number at the beginning divided by two.
kpi.calculation: Number of customer complaints / Average number of customers * 100

kpi.name: Percentage of Escalations
kpi.definition: The number of escalations expressed as a percentage of total installations
kpi.calculation: Escalations / Total Installations * 100

kpi.name: Percentage of complaint solution in % of every involved department
kpi.definition: Measuring time and expenses in all departments involved that are charged to solve customers complaints
kpi.calculation: Sum of working time for processing the customer compliants in hours / Sum of total working times of all departments involved in the complaint management in hours * 100

kpi.name: Return Rate
kpi.definition: The Return Rate indicates how many items coming back because the customer was not satisfied with the order
kpi.calculation: Number of return items / Total number of order items * 100

scenario.name: Incidence Reporting & CAPA
scenario.description: In all regulatory environments, incidence reporting is considered as a critical indicator for product quality and safety. Incidence reporting describes the process of recording, investigating (including CAPA analysis) and managing non-conformances across the supply chain, both within the organization and the extended enterprise. In addition, secure access controls visibility for tracking critical case information and performing trend analysis across the organization.

process.name: Incidence Identification
process.description: The process of reporting an incident begins whenever any out-of-specification or non-conformance occurs in the supply chain. It is triggered automatically by the system that maintains the operational process. Compliance is automatically built into the system through alerts to the responsible department, therefore enforcing quick remedial action. Streamline response time and improve service quality by classifying the recorded incident and trigger automatic or manual routing for appropriate response or triage based on the captured attributes.

Adhere to compliance requirements with full audit trail log.

process.description: Improve speed of case resolution and decision making ability by presenting alternatives suggested during investigation adhering to 21CFR Part 11 requirements. Disposition addresses verifying the method of resolution and confirming that it does not affect other areas of product and process. Enforcing approvals by using digital signatures adhering to 21CFR Part 11 enables justification that the selected course of action taken in order to resolve the incident is adequate.

process.name: Corrective Action Preventive Action (CAPA)
process.description: Corrective and preventive action is a formal process required by regulatory authorities for categorizing the issue, documenting, tracking and implementing the findings to prevent reoccurrence of the root cause of the complaint and improving product and process quality. Root cause analysis deals with analyzing in details the source of problem by testing product and process to refine, improve and identify reasons for failure of product or inconsistency in process operations. Electronic CAPA processing also requires satisfying regulatory requirements like 21 CFR Part 11, for example through use of digital signatures.

variant.name: Condition-Based Maintenance
variant.description: Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) enables you to make maintenance decisions based on actual condition, rather than time or usage interval. You can identify equipment problems early, when they are less costly to correct, and perform maintenance only when needed, thereby increasing asset utilization, extending equipment life, and reducing maintenance costs. Examples of CBM are vibration, temperature, oil analysis.Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) enables you to make maintenance decisions based on actual condition, rather than time or usage interval. You can identify equipment problems early, when they are less costly to correct, and perform maintenance only when needed, thereby increasing asset utilization, extending equipment life, and reducing maintenance costs. Examples of CBM are vibration, temperature, oil analysis.

kpi.name: Customer Satisfaction Index
kpi.definition: Customer Satisfaction Index is an abstract measure how well the company serves the customers. It can't be predefined, because the company has to find out, what the customers want and then look how well they fulfill the needs of the customers. Usually it is an index.
kpi.calculation:
Example for a procedure to calculate the customer satisfaction index:
Within a customer survey customer can assess his general satisfaction to a scale between 1 (totally unsatisfied) until 10 (totally satisfied)
Calculation as follows:
Sum of all rating values / number of participants of survey, then mapping this average value to scale (the higher the value, the better the satisfaction)
This procedure can be executed also for other aspects then "general satisfaction" to develop a deeper insight in the customer satisfaction.

kpi.name: Total number of incidents
kpi.definition: Number of indicents in a defined period of time
kpi.calculation: Sum of incidents in a defined period of time

kpi.name: Mean elapsed time to achieve incident resolution or circumvention, broken down by impact code
kpi.definition: Total process time for all incidents divided by number of incidents. Risk management and QM gives input for categorising the impacts; a refelction of every code is recommended.
kpi.calculation: Total process time for all incidents / Number of all incidents

kpi.name: Percentage of incidents handled within agreed response time
kpi.definition: Percentage of incidents handled within agreed response time
kpi.calculation: (Number of incidents handeld within agreed resonse time * 100) / Total number of responded incidents

kpi.name: Average cost per incident
kpi.definition: Total costs of incident handling (service desk in total, sales & marketing partly, other involved departments partly) / Number of incidents
kpi.calculation: Sum of costs for processing incidents (service desk in total, sales & marketing partly, other involved departments partly) in a period / Number of incidents in a period

kpi.name: Percentage of incidents closed by service desk without reference to other levels
kpi.definition: Percentage of incidents closed by service desk without reference to other levels.
kpi.calculation: Number of incidents closed by service desk without reference to other levels / Number of all incidents * 100

scenario.name: Secure Tracking and Tracing
scenario.description: The goal of drug tracking and tracing is to prevent unsafe product from entering the supply chain by establishing a secure electronic pedigree so that every unit of medication is authenticated. The use of Electronic Product Code (EPC) technology allows individual product units to be tracked, traced and monitored using radio frequency identification (RFID). This technology can be used in conjunction with current business processes designed to track and trace product.

process.name: Supply Chain Process with RFID
process.description: RFID can be used in several supply chain business processes like closed loop outbound-inbound logistics process, packaging process, returnable asset tracking etc.Outbound-Inbound process starts with customer ordering goods using purchase order and supplier sending goods using sales order, covers entire distribution aspects like picking, packing, shipping, post goods issue for outbound delivery and sending an ASN to customer which accepts goods receipt for incoming delivery and unloads goods.Packaging process addresses manufacturing aspects covered under product quality - compliant manufacturing scenario integrating RFID during packaging goods.

process.name: Capture EPC
process.description: Capture accurate RFID tag data containing EPC codes from product units during read by shop-floor devices. Enable automatic inbound and outbound process with full integration to a back end (ERP) system. Validate automatically EPC data during goods movement and provide it to business partners thru documents like Advance Shipping Notification (ASN).

process-feature.name: Master Data and No. Range Management

process.name: Product Tracking & Authentication (PTA)
process.description: The Product Tracking and Authentication solution enables companies to ensure safe production and secure distribution of their products by providing visibility and traceability of product flow across the enterprise and the extended supply chain network. It provides the following features :

process.name: Reporting
process.description: Provide business reporting with alerts for proactive decision making, technical and performance monitoring. Business reporting includes stock situation at different locations, feeds from major retailers such as WalMart, movements across locations, movements at location by action type (for example : commissioning, pack, pick, load, etc.) Technical reporting includes quality aspects like read rates and write rates.

process-feature.name: Alert, Event & Exception Management
process-feature.description: SAPâ€™s Alert and Event Management deals with proactively detecting critical events that are triggered due to unexpected situations. These alerts allow organizations to react faster in order to take remedial action.

process-feature.name: Pedigree Interface & Reporting
process-feature.description: As product movement occur between business partners within the supply chain, pedigree reporting provide the ability to identify unsafe products in the supply chain by providing product information such as source of the material, material specifications, EPC number, date of production, etc and provision for integrating to EPC global information system (IS).

kpi.name: Number of Deliveries without Complete and Accurate Documentation for tracking and tracing
kpi.definition: Number of deliveries without correct documentation supporting the order, including packing slips, bills of lading, invoices, etc.
kpi.calculation: Number of Deliveries without Complete and Accurate Documentation for Tracking and Tracing

kpi.name: Number of counterfeited packing units per product group discovered in % of all sold units
kpi.definition: Number of counterfeited packing units per product group discovered in % of all sold units. Data should be collected in a defined time period (year, quarter).
kpi.calculation: Number of counterfeited packaging units per product group discovered / Total number of packaging units per product group * 100
